item.title: Cream of mushroom soup recipe!
item.description:
https://www.triedandtruerecipe.com/easy-cream-of-mushroom-soup/ This is one of my most popular recipes! I serve it with smoky mushrooms on top and it's soooo good! 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil 1 yellow onion (peeled and finely diced) 4 tablespoons butter 1½ pounds baby bella mushrooms (sliced; or use a mix of your favorite mushrooms such as shiitake, maitake, or oyster) 6 cloves garlic (peeled and minced) 2 teaspoons dry thyme (or use 2 tablespoons freshly minced thyme) 6 tablespoons flour 5 cups water (or low-sodium vegetable stock) ½ cup heavy cream Salt and pepper 1 tablespoon fresh chives (minced; optional, for serving) Smoky mushrooms: 2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil ¾ pound fresh mushrooms (thinly sliced or torn, depending on variety) ¾ teaspoon smoked paprika Salt to taste Sauté the onion: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the diced onion and cook for 6 to 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it softens and deepens in color. Season lightly with salt. Cook the mushrooms: Melt 4 tablespoons of butter into the onions. Add half of the mushrooms and cook for 3 to 4 minutes until they just begin to cook down. Add the rest of the mushrooms and continue sautéeing, stirring occasionally, for 25 to 30 minutes. Allow the mushrooms time to release all their liquid and for the liquid to evaporate. Don't rush the process! Continue cooking until the mushrooms deepen in color. Adjust the heat as necessary to prevent them from burning. Add the garlic and thyme: Add the minced garlic and 2 teaspoons of thyme to the mushrooms and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper and cook for 1 minute. Make the roux: Sprinkle the flour over the mushrooms and stir to combine. Cook for 2 minutes. Add 5 cups of water or stock in 1-cup increments, whisking after each addition. Continue adding and whisking until all of the stock has been incorporated. Taste and season to your preferences. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat and simmer, uncovered, for 20 minutes. Finish the cream of mushroom soup: Pour the heavy cream into the soup and stir to combine. Simmer for 10 minutes. Taste and season once more to your preferences. Cook the smoky mushrooms: While the cream of mushroom soup finishes simmering, prepare the mushroom topping. Heat 2 teaspoons of extra virgin olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Once hot, add the mushrooms and cook them in an even layer, about 4 to 5 minutes per side. Stir them occasionally to prevent them from burning. Once the mushrooms are golden-brown all over, turn off the heat. Season them lightly with salt and ¾ teaspoon smoked paprika. Toss to coat and remove from the skillet. Transfer them to a bowl. To serve: Ladle the soup into bowls and garnish each bowl with smoky mushrooms and minced chives. Enjoy!
I forgot to get a picture of me with it, but here I am about to taste it lol!
The whole process!
item.dc:creator: triedandtruerecipes

item.title: Last update for the year
item.description: So, the weight is th same as the last update I did in August, but this is the final update for the year. I may have not lost a lot numbers wise but this is big for me. I’m almost ‘better’ from my herniated disk re-herniating. I’ve started to tentatively work out again. And I got a desk job where I can stand whenever I want. I’ve cut out most shitty foods. I drink way less soda and more water/poweraide. Where I may have not lost much numbers, I FEEL so much better and more confident than I ever have…. Ever. Here’s to next year, maybe hitting under 200?

I'd love to find out
Oh that? I was trapped in a magic oil lamp for 10,000 years
Costco had half gallon jars of mango chunks in light syrup. I bought 3 of them over the course of the summer then they stopped selling them. That was in 2021. I'll never forget them.
Oh and measles.
I promise these three awful puns in a row was unintentional.
Just finished Leviathan, started Behemoth last night. It's a good thing.
This dump goes out to all you ass-asses out there.

item.title: GovBrief Today #292
item.description: Trump's own supporters finally forced his hand today. After months of White House pressure to bury the Epstein files, the GOP broke ranks and voted with the Democrats. The House voted 427-1 to compel their release. Hours later, the Senate passed it unanimously. When ABC's Mary Bruce asked why Trump doesn't just order the release himself instead of waiting for Congress, he threatened to revoke the network's broadcast license. The other consequence arrived in Texas. A Trump-appointed federal judge ruled it was racial gerrymandering after Abbott explicitly directed the Legislature to redistrict based on race. Texas was the centerpiece of Trump's strategy to protect the Republican House majority in 2026. If the ruling stands while California's Democratic counter-map proceeds, Republicans don't just fail to expand their majority. They could lose the House entirely. The consequences are arriving because people forced them to arrive. Call your representatives tomorrow. Demand they hold the line on the Epstein files. The bill is on Trump's desk and he says he'll sign it. Make sure he does. Tell them you're watching what happens next. Notice you're seeing less news on social media? We track the data - you're right. Social media networks are suppressing news stories more every day. Want to stop missing what matters? Get every brief in your inbox, 7 nights a week. Data, images, searchable archive. Free and private at govbrief.today. #GovBriefToday #Resist Subscribe (It's Free!) - https://gbounacos.substack.com [1] https://go.govbrief.today/abbott-cair-terrorist [2] https://go.govbrief.today/voters-reject-bases-ecuador [3] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-saudi-major-ally [4] https://go.govbrief.today/saudi-prince-return-us [5] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-hiv-exclude-sa [6] https://go.govbrief.today/ice-releases-blind-man [7] https://go.govbrief.today/alabama-state-senate-map [8] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-abc-license-threat [9] https://go.govbrief.today/three-mile-island-loan [10] https://go.govbrief.today/dems-illegal-military-orders [11] https://go.govbrief.today/louisiana-immigration-border-agents [12] https://go.govbrief.today/plaskett-censure-voted-down [13] https://go.govbrief.today/chuy-garcia-vote [14] https://go.govbrief.today/epstein-vote-near-unanimous [15] https://go.govbrief.today/education-begins-transfers [16] https://go.govbrief.today/white-house-tate-intervention [17] https://go.govbrief.today/texas-map-blocked Subscribe (It's Free!) - https://gbounacos.substack.com

item.title: Larry Summers ...acknowledges he is on the list.
item.description: He is Larry Summers, former president of Harvard and former Secretary of the Treasury under Bubba. He ran cover for Epstein and was involved in an email exchange with him (well after Epstein’s first conviction) in which he discusses having gross inappropriate feelings for one of his students. Edit: he was also asking Epstein advice on how to keep the power imbalance over a woman he trains so he could get sexual favors, and getting all jealous and territorial whenever she talked to or met other men. He resigned from the open AI board. He’s still teaching at Harvard. They need to fire him.
item.dc:creator: SquaresNews

item.title: Capitalist Enshittification of Everything...
item.description: You feel it every time you fight through a wall of ads on a site that used to just work. You see it in every pointless "AI" feature that gets rammed down your throat, and every update that seems designed to make your already shitty device even slower. Anyone see this as "elite incompetence"? I don't. Because this is the fucking strategy. Our attention is the product, and being constantly upset & "triggered" is the price. Every moment of our online lives is now a transaction, folks (has been for a long time tbh). Every tool we come to rely on is eventually locked behind a paywall, smashing the open web up into a feudal digital estate where we're the perpetual tenants. The logic is perverse, but brutally effective. A good, fluid experience is a wasted opportunity for profit. This is why these scumfucks inject friction. They demand your personal data, geo-block content, design clumsy af interfaces, and so on... Why? Because their real business is surveillance. Get it? what's happening is that our fucking lives are being harvested into "data points" to be packaged, sold, and probably leaked at some point in the next corporate breach of the firewall. What's the result? Nothing works as it should. We're drowning in spam and gatekeeping. A constant, aggravating reminder that we're not even really customers anymore, but rather the resource being fucking strip-mined. /endrant
